reviewText: Ok look , I really wanted to like this game , It looks pretty good has some nice tunes and sound effects .... but the gameplay is very frustrating in that the enemy just have no AI whatsoever its like your ship is a magnet and they just overwhelm you and just stick to your ship ... i dont know if the Dev's designed it this way , but it just doesn't work. I cant in all honesty recommend the game at the moment . Fix the enemy AI and it would be a really good shooter.
voteText: 22 of 26 people (85%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: I've been looking a long time for a substitute for an old top down space shmup, Silent Death, trying out various other games in the genre... This ain't that substitute. This feels more like Developer's First Shmup, taking Asteroids and barely improving on it. The controls feel very off, and the enemy AI is downright terrible, there's no intelligence involved whatsoever, things just fly directly at you and hover on you once they get there. I don't normally knock spelling and grammar in games, since I know developers can come from anywhere in the world, but this one is particularly bad on that front. Space Pirates and Zombies or Ring Runner would definitely be the better games in this style to go with.
voteText: 23 of 35 people (66%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Deep Eclipse: New Space Odyssey looks okay, has some nice tunes and sound effects, but the gameplay is very aggravating!!! The enemies stick to your ship like your ship is a magnet and they just overwhelm you. There is no escaping them, then you're dead. Not at all fun!!! 0/10

reviewText:
Product received for free

I got this game from the Otakumaker #11 Bundle so i guess it counts as free game".
____________________

First i wasn't sure about the game
date:
it looked very odd to me and based on the reviews i thought it's going to be garbage (Nothing against the devs) The first minutes of gameplay were a bit boring because i only had a few weapons but later on it became quite intense and with like 10 weapons in the inventory it became fun to play. Especially the Disco-Gun which made me laugh.

==Gameplay==
Not the best gameplay i've ever seen because the controls are quite tricky but after a while you learn how this game works and it becomes easier for you to dodge and aim at enemies. The enemies are also very nice. There are quite a few different enemies
recommended:
from normal tackling melee enemies up to pulling scorpion enemies there is a large variety of enemies.

==Graphics==
You cannot really compare the graphics with other games
hoursPlayed: but it's nice to look at them especially in the later levels. 5 Stages
voteText:
each stage using the same map but due to different locations and angles the background always changes and becomes more awesome over time. Generally most of the weapons are great designed. "Disco Gun" is one of them :P

==Great progression system==
Chose between Technological and Organic
helpfulPercent: each of them giving you access to a specific set of weapons and abilities. This is great due to different gameplay tactics and progression tactic. 30 Perks pretty much buff your entire ship or the environment around you
votesHelpful: as example "Summon" spawns sometimes a black hole that fires a laser to a random enemy
votesFunny: there are a lot of unique weapons. Each of them offers something special. I don't want to spoil the special guns so let me stay with the regular weapons. Laser as example is a - you guessed it - laser weapon that fires regular low damage bullets to your enemies. Magnetic gun however is more of a shotgun type
commentsCount: Singularity gun is a wave cannon with piercing effect. And there are so many more weapon
column16:
from heavy but long recharging weapons up to unique weapons like the Disco-Gun which makes everyone dance... literally.

Negative:
The third boss is so annoying -_-

Other than that
column18: if it is on sale or within a bundle. Maybe not on it's full price.\n\nPlayed 10 hours total
